procedures.name: Informed consent

code.decode: Psychological Tests (used as a proxy code when no direct procedural code is specified)

procedures.label: Informed Consent
procedures.description: Obtain written informed consent prior to performing study-specific procedures

procedures.name: Clinical research unit admission

code.decode: Initial hospital care, per day (representative)

procedures.label: Admit to unit (CRU)
procedures.description: Participant admission to the clinical research unit for inpatient study procedures and metabolic monitoring

procedures.name: Clinical research unit discharge

code.decode: Hospital discharge day management (30 minutes or less)

procedures.label: Discharge from unit (CRU)
procedures.description: Discharge after completion of inpatient procedures and safety review

procedures.name: Outpatient visit

code.decode: Office or other outpatient visit for the evaluation and management of an established patient (representative)

procedures.label: Outpatient Visit
procedures.description: Scheduled outpatient visit during outpatient period (may include safety lab assessment)

procedures.name: Telephone follow-up

code.decode: Telephone evaluation and management service (representative)

procedures.label: Phone Call
procedures.description: Phone call during outpatient period; may occur on a different day than blood draw

procedures.name: Eligibility assessment

code.decode: Office or other outpatient visit for the evaluation and management of a new patient (representative)

procedures.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criteria Assessment
procedures.description: Assessment of participant eligibility including inclusion and exclusion criteria

procedures.name: Contraception counseling and documentation

code.decode: Preventive medicine counseling (approx. 15 minutes)

procedures.label: Contraception Discussion/Documentation
procedures.description: Discuss and document contraception requirements per protocol

procedures.name: Follicle-stimulating hormone test

code.decode: Gonadotropin; follicle stimulating hormone

procedures.label: FSH Laboratory Test
procedures.description: FSH test for post-menopausal status confirmation when needed

procedures.name: Alcohol test

code.decode: Alcohols, any specimen, except breath; quantitative

procedures.label: Alcohol Test
procedures.description: Alcohol testing as part of screening/check-in procedures

procedures.name: Urine drug screen

code.decode: Drug test(s), presumptive, any number of drug classes

procedures.label: Urine Drug Screen
procedures.description: Urine drug screening as part of screening/check-in procedures

procedures.name: Infectious disease screening labs

code.decode: HIV-1/2 antigen and antibodies, combination assay (representative for HIV screen)

procedures.label: HIV, Hepatitis B and C Screen
procedures.description: Screening for HIV and hepatitis B and C infection

procedures.name: Medical history and demographics collection

code.decode: Office or other outpatient visit (minimal), used as representative documentation encounter

procedures.label: Medical History/Demographics
procedures.description: Collect participant demographics and medical history including WD history and prior treatments

procedures.name: Physical examination

code.decode: Office or other outpatient visit for the evaluation and management of a new patient (representative)

procedures.label: Complete Physical Exam
procedures.description: Complete physical exam including cardiovascular, respiratory, gastrointestinal, and neurological systems; symptom-driven exams as needed

procedures.name: Anthropometric measurements

code.decode: Laboratory HbA1c (used as placeholder; no universal CPT for BMI measurement alone)

procedures.label: Height/Weight/BMI
procedures.description: Measure height (screening only), weight, and calculate BMI per schedule

procedures.name: Enrollment/registration

code.decode: Encounter for examination for normal comparison and control in clinical research program

procedures.label: Enrollment/Inclusion
procedures.description: Formal enrollment and registration into study prior to initiating controlled diet and dosing

procedures.name: Discontinuation of chelation therapy

code.decode: Other long term (current) drug therapy (context for therapy management; discontinuation not uniquely coded)

procedures.label: Stop Chelation Therapy
procedures.description: Discontinue chelator therapy prior to ALXN1840 initiation to allow baseline copper balance assessment

procedures.name: Discontinuation of zinc therapy

code.decode: Other long term (current) drug therapy (context for therapy management; discontinuation not uniquely coded)

procedures.label: Stop Zinc Therapy
procedures.description: Discontinue zinc therapy per protocol timing

procedures.name: Oral administration of study intervention

code.decode: Introduction of other therapeutic substance into gastrointestinal tract, per orifice (representative for oral administration)

procedures.label: ALXN1840 Dosing (oral tablets)
procedures.description: Daily oral administration of ALXN1840 after overnight fast; administered with 240 mL water; meals delayed at least 2 hours post-dose

procedures.name: Study intervention compliance confirmation

code.decode: Telephone assessment and management by nonphysician health care professional (representative for remote monitoring interaction)

procedures.label: Dose Compliance Monitoring
procedures.description: Confirm outpatient dosing compliance using SMS text messaging

procedures.name: Venipuncture / blood draw

code.decode: Collection of venous blood by venipuncture

procedures.label: Blood Sampling
procedures.description: Repeated blood draws for PK/PD and safety labs; predose trough and timed postdose samples on specified days

procedures.name: Peripheral IV cannula placement

code.decode: Introduction of needle or intracatheter, vein

procedures.label: IV Cannula Placement
procedures.description: Placement of a cannula to minimize needle sticks for repeated blood sampling; catheter not left longer than 72 hours; flush at least every 8 hours

procedures.name: Clinical safety laboratory assessments

code.decode: Comprehensive metabolic panel (representative for serum chemistry)

procedures.label: Safety Labs (Chemistry/Hematology/Coagulation/Urinalysis)
procedures.description: Routine safety labs including serum chemistry, hematology, coagulation parameters, and urinalysis; generally after at least 8 hours fasting for routine safety samples

procedures.name: Urinalysis

code.decode: Urinalysis, by dip stick or tablet reagent

procedures.label: Urinalysis
procedures.description: Urinalysis as part of clinical safety laboratory assessments

procedures.name: Pregnancy testing

code.decode: Chorionic gonadotropin, qualitative

procedures.label: Urine/Serum Pregnancy Test
procedures.description: Pregnancy testing at protocol-specified visits; females of childbearing potential perform urine pregnancy tests at least every 4 weeks at home or site

procedures.name: Serum sample retention

code.decode: Collection of venous blood by venipuncture (for serum sample)

procedures.label: Retained Serum Sample
procedures.description: Retain a single 15 mL serum sample for evaluation in event of unexpected safety finding

procedures.name: Vital signs assessment

code.decode: Noninvasive ear or pulse oximetry for oxygen saturation; single determination (representative; no single CPT covers full vital signs set)

procedures.label: Vital Signs
procedures.description: Measure body temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and systolic/diastolic blood pressure; predose unless specified

procedures.name: Electrocardiogram

code.decode: Electrocardiogram, routine ECG with at least 12 leads; with interpretation and report

procedures.label: Triplicate 12-Lead ECG
procedures.description: Triplicate 12-lead ECGs collected predose unless specified; on Days 1 and 39 also at 4 hours postdose

procedures.name: Adverse event assessment

code.decode: Office or other outpatient visit (representative for safety monitoring documentation)

procedures.label: AE/SAE Monitoring
procedures.description: Ongoing collection and follow-up of adverse events and serious adverse events through study visits

procedures.name: Copper/molybdenum-controlled diet

code.decode: Medical nutrition therapy; initial assessment and intervention

procedures.label: Controlled Meals (Cu/Mo-controlled)
procedures.description: Initiate and maintain controlled copper/molybdenum diet during inpatient periods; encourage adherence outpatient

procedures.name: Food and fluid batch sampling

code.decode: Handling and/or conveyance of specimen for transfer (representative)

procedures.label: Food/Fluid Collection for Cu/Mo Concentrations
procedures.description: Collect samples of meal and fluid batches (minimum 3 complete portions per batch) and water from dispenser for copper/molybdenum analysis

procedures.name: 24-hour urine collection

code.decode: Urinalysis; volume measurement

procedures.label: 24-Hour Urine Collection (Cu/Mo)
procedures.description: Collect and pool urine over 24-hour periods; record volume; analyze for copper and molybdenum concentration/content

procedures.name: Fecal (stool) collection

code.decode: Stool analysis (limited CPT specificity; representative for stool specimen analysis)

procedures.label: Stool Collection (Cu/Mo)
procedures.description: Individually collect fecal samples; record date/time/weight; store and analyze for copper and molybdenum concentration/content

procedures.name: Inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry

code.decode: Molecular pathology procedure (used as placeholder; ICP-MS not uniquely coded in standard CPT/HCPCS in this excerpt)

procedures.label: ICP-MS Elemental Analysis
procedures.description: Laboratory quantification of copper and molybdenum concentrations in food, fluids, urine, feces, and plasma samples

procedures.name: Bowel and urine output monitoring

code.decode: Remote physiologic monitoring treatment management services (representative for monitoring activity)

procedures.label: Urination/Bowel Movement Monitoring
procedures.description: Monitor and record urination and bowel movements; include menstruation checks where applicable

procedures.name: Intake monitoring

code.decode: Medical nutrition therapy; re-assessment and intervention (representative)

procedures.label: Food/Fluid Intake Monitoring
procedures.description: Monitor and document intake for copper/molybdenum balance calculations (food, drink, investigational agent)

procedures.name: Light exercise regimen

code.decode: Therapeutic exercises to develop strength and endurance, range of motion and flexibility

procedures.label: Standardized Light Exercise
procedures.description: Protocol-specified light exercise regimen during balance assessment periods

medicalDevices.name: 12-lead electrocardiograph
medicalDevices.label: 12-lead ECG device
medicalDevices.description: Device used to acquire triplicate 12-lead ECGs including specified postdose timepoints

medicalDevices.name: Automated blood pressure monitor
medicalDevices.label: Automated BP device
medicalDevices.description: Completely automated device used for blood pressure and heart rate measurements; manual technique only if automated device unavailable

medicalDevices.name: Inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometer
medicalDevices.label: ICP-MS
medicalDevices.description: Analytical instrument used to determine copper and molybdenum concentrations in collected samples

medicalDevices.name: Peripheral intravenous cannula/catheter
medicalDevices.label: IV cannula
medicalDevices.description: Cannula/catheter placed for repeated blood draws; not left in place longer than 72 hours; flushed at least every 8 hours

medicalDevices.name: Water bottle dispenser
medicalDevices.label: Water dispenser
medicalDevices.description: Shared large water bottle dispenser used to supply participant water; sampled for copper/molybdenum content
